* **End Plates and Stability**: Vertically positioned end plates at both ends of the pallet further restrict longitudinal movement and provide stability when loaded and wrapped. The end plates can be secured to the stack of trays by wrapping.
* **Customization and Materials**: The pallet system can be customized for different tray sizes and shapes. The pallet cap and end plates can be made of plastic materials such as polypropylene or ABS plastic, using methods like thermoforming, rotomolding, or injection molding.

* The electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension comprises a saucer shell, a saucer cabin, a rotary-wing system, and a control system.
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system, consisting of magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, an electromotive ring, a magnetic suspension shaft, and a magnetic suspension guide rail.
* The magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels are suspended in space and go around the magnetic suspension shaft under an electromagnetic thrust.
* The magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system can be improved to include coaxial axial dual or radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing systems to overcome reactive torque.

• The invention relates to streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, a process for their production, and their use in isolation, purification, and detection of proteins.
• The streptavidin muteins are characterized by at least one mutation in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, resulting in a higher binding affinity for peptide ligands compared to wild-type streptavidin.
• The invention also relates to a nucleic acid encoding the streptavidin mutein, a vector containing the nucleic acid, a cell transformed with the vector, and a reagent kit containing the streptavidin mutein.

• **Guanylation Reactions**: The invention describes methods for forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, specifically focusing on guanylating amines or pyrrolidines with guanylating agents like thioureas or isothioureas.
• **Nickel Catalysts**: Preferred catalysts are in the zero oxidation state, derived from alloys like nickel-boride, nickel-phosphide, aluminum-nickel, or supported on kieselguhr or silica/alumina. The catalyst should be present at less than 10 molar % nickel, preferably less than 5 molar %.
• **Guanylating Agents**: Thioureas and isothioureas are preferred, with at least one protecting group (like Boc, Cbz, or arylsulfonyl) on the nitrogen atoms. Bis-Boc-protected thioureas and isothioureas are particularly preferred.
• **Reaction Conditions**: The reactions are carried out at temperatures ranging from -30 to 140°C, preferably at room temperature or under ambient conditions, in a solvent system comprising DMF, THF, DMSO, or water mixed with any of these. The reaction time and yield vary depending on the guanylating agent used.
• **Applications**: The methods allow for the synthesis of N-substituted and N,N-disubstituted guanidines, which are important structural components in many biologically active compounds, including drugs like cimetidine and tiotidine. The use of nickel catalysts offers advantages such as low cost, ease of recovery, and the ability to carry out reactions under mild conditions with high yields.

<summary>
* The invention provides an apparatus for continuous electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
* The apparatus includes a means for supplying the aluminum strip or wire.
* An anodic oxidation bath with a cathode is used to anodize the aluminum strip or wire.
* An electrolytic coloring bath with an anode is used to color the anodized aluminum strip or wire.
* The electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid.
* An electric circuit connects the cathode and anode to a power source, making the aluminum strip or wire function as an anode in the anodic oxidation bath and a cathode in the electrolytic coloring bath.
* A means for passing the aluminum strip or wire continuously through the baths is included.
* The anodic oxidation bath composition is usually an aqueous solution of 10 to 55% sulfuric acid.
* The thickness of the oxide film formed on the aluminum strip or wire should be thicker than 4 microns.
* The electric current used in the anodic oxidation can be a direct current or direct and alternating superposed currents.
</summary>

* The invention provides a process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest and capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process comprises providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors, which are adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination in said plant cells for producing a non-replicating recombination product containing said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process also comprises selecting plants or plant cells expressing said function of interest.
* The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of said at least two different vectors, said sequence portions being necessary for expressing said function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a coated swash plate to reduce friction and wear.
* The swash plate is made of aluminum or aluminum alloy with less than 10% silicon.
* The coating is a heat-curable, cross-linked polyfluoro elastomer bonded directly to the aluminum, with lubricious and load-bearing additives.
* The coating is applied by liquid spray and cured at an elevated temperature.
* The coating provides a smooth surface, eliminating the need for high finish polishing.
* The coating is applied to the facial and end surfaces of the swash plate.
* The coating permits the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base material.
* The coating does not require metal plating or high finish polishing.
* The coating provides high durability and low coefficient of friction.
* The coating is applied to the swash plate facial surfaces and end surface simultaneously.
</summary>

* **Polymers for Anti-reflective Coatings:**
	+ Polymers represented by formulas 1, 2, and 3, synthesized using polyhydroxystyrene, poly(styrene-acrylate), or novolac resin and diazonaphthoquinone halide.
	+ Polymers absorb light strongly at 193 nm and 248 nm, preventing reflection and standing wave effects in photolithography.
* **Anti-reflective Coating Composition and Process:**
	+ Composition comprises polymers of formulas 1, 2, or 3, optionally with light-absorbing compounds from Tables 1a and 1b, in an organic solvent.
	+ Coating process involves filtering the composition, coating it on a wafer, and hard-baking to form a cross-linked, spectroscopically stable anti-reflective coating.

• The white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film comprises a crystallizable thermoplastic as the principal constituent, at least one white pigment, at least one UV absorber, and at least one flame retardant.
• The film has excellent optical and mechanical properties, good orientability, and thermoformability, and does not embrittle on exposure to heat.

• The process for producing 143a involves continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 142b using heterogeneous catalysis.
• The organic feed is 142b and the fluorinating agent is HF.
• The process is carried out in a reactor at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 100° C. and 280° C., and more preferably between 120° C. and 200° C.
• The catalyst has to be activated first using nitrogen, air or HF/142b at a temperature between 100° C. and 650° C., preferably between 200° C. and 500° C.
• Hydrofluorination is performed at a pressure between 1 atmosphere (0 psig) and 200 psig, preferably between 1 atmosphere and 150 psig.
• The molar ratio of HF:142b can vary between greater than 1:1 and 20:1, preferably between greater than 1:1 and 10:1, and more preferably between 2:1 and 5:1.
• The contact time can be varied from 1-100 seconds and is preferably between 5 and 15 seconds.

• The invention relates to an improved process for preparing certain pyrazolotriazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors.
• The improvement involves using hypophosphorous acid in the deacylation and desulfurization step.
• This reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities formed.
• The process produces hydrogen sulfide as a by-product, which is easily removed.
• Hypophosphorous acid does not reduce nitro groups or affect other functional groups in the molecule.
• The process is straight-forward, economical, and readily adaptable by industry.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by sequentially taking partial quantities from individual fiber bales.
* In the method, the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale is measured before each pass, and a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity is determined and removed only from the measured fiber bale.
* The partial quantities are removed in a predetermined number of passes, with the last partial quantity remaining in each fiber bale processed during the last pass.
* The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and that an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
* In a preferred embodiment, the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than by the end of a predetermined period to maintain a time schedule for the opening of the fiber bales.
* The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the bale opener based on signals from the quantity measuring device.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with parallel yarns in each layer.
• The apparatus includes parallel conveyors with needles, yarn carriers, and rake systems with needles at angles corresponding to the yarn carriers.
• The yarn carriers move back and forth between the conveyors, placing yarns onto the needles of the conveyors or rake systems.
• The rake systems move in a direction opposite the fabric formation to deposit the yarns onto the conveyor needles.
• For some layers, the rake systems can move a shorter distance, causing overlap of return courses onto first courses, while maintaining parallelism.
• The fabric layers are then bonded together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding before impregnation and curing.

• The invention relates to weft insertion in a multiple-color air jet loom.
• Different weft carrying forces are produced for different weft threads to ensure stable insertion and prevent wasteful air consumption.
• This is achieved by using subnozzles with different pitches, orifice diameters, or air pressures, or by varying the air ejection time.
• The main nozzle and subnozzles are supplied with air under different pressures or for different intervals of time, depending on the selected weft thread.

* The invention provides a process for spinning bast fibres, involving twice health-preserving and spinning into yarn.
* The process reduces end breakage rate, improving work efficiency and product quality.
* The invention also provides a process for blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, with similar benefits.

• The invention relates to a sensing roll for use in a nip press, which comprises strategically-placed sensors to measure pressure at various cross-directional positions along the roll. The sensors are arranged in multiple sets, with each set spaced apart circumferentially from the others. This arrangement allows for multiple pressure readings to be taken at each cross-directional position, which can then be averaged to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The invention also provides methods for sensing and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of a sensing roll. These methods involve providing a sensing roll with multiple pressure-measuring sensors at each cross-directional position, measuring the pressure exerted on each sensor as it enters the nip region, and calculating an average pressure measurement at each cross-directional position. This average measurement can then be used to create a nip pressure profile for the nip press.

* The apparatus is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board, featuring a releasable clamp, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder.
* The cord support is pivotable and can be retracted for storage, while the article holder can be selectively attached and detached from the apparatus.

<summary>
* The buttonhole controlling device of the invention includes a foot pad attachable to a presser bar and a travelling assembly with an initial position defined by oppositely acting springs.
* The travelling assembly moves with the work during buttonhole sewing and includes a slidable member positionable by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.
* The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine during movement of the assembly, limiting the buttonhole length to that suitable for the inserted button.
* An adjustable stop mounted on the travelling assembly engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing precise definition of the closure point.
* The device is designed to prevent the formation of open or overlapping buttonhole stitches, regardless of the type of material being sewn.
* The machine sews top bar and left leg stitches with the tripping lever in a forward position, and bottom bar and right leg stitches with the lever in a rearward position.
* The operator can adjust the stop to compensate for different materials' slippage, ensuring perfect buttonholes are sewn in garments of varying fabrics.
</summary>

<summary>
* The fabric treatment apparatus comprises a conveyor with an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a horizontal path.
* A liquid applicator applies the treatment solution to the web at a first station along the path.
* A suction device removes the liquid from the web at a second station downstream of the first station.
* The suction device extends transversely to the web and belt and is disposed below and juxtaposed to an upper section of the belt.
* A dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and single layer through at least one dwell loop between the applicator and the suction device.
* In one embodiment, the dwell stretch is an air pass with freely rotatable rollers guiding the web in vertically extending loops.
* In another embodiment, the dwell stretch includes a freely rotatable drum and rollers guiding the web in a meander path around the drum.
* The suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt to cause the web to adhere to the belt and be entrained thereby.
</summary>

• The dry cleaner has separate air flow systems for ambient air intake and solvent vapor recovery.
• The intake system draws air through the access opening when the door is opened, minimizing solvent vapor escape.
• The exhaust system, exclusive of the intake system, recovers solvent vapors from the tubs and storage tank.
• A refrigeration system maintains the solvent temperature and condenses vapors in the condenser housing.
• The machine has a timer-controlled cycle including fill, wash, drain, spin, and dry portions.
• During the dry portion, heated air circulates through the tubs, vaporizing solvent from the clothes.
• The refrigeration system alternatively cools the storage tank and condenser housing evaporator coils.
• The machine has a control system for normal operation and a "cartridge dry" mode for filter replacement.
• The "cartridge dry" mode dries the filters within the tub using the machine's drying system without advancing the timer.

• The invention provides a method and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments.
• The system uses a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width.
• The slot produces a linear plane of filaments with constant filament distribution across the machine width.
• The quench fluid, usually air, is used for both quenching and drawing the filaments.
• The drawing chamber is small, allowing for higher quench pressures without structural deflection.
• The slot gap opening determines the necessary drawing tension.
• Filament cooling is controlled by regulating quench fluid temperature and exhaust flow rate.
• The apparatus is constructed and the method carried out within certain ranges of parameters.
• The invention solves problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems and improves web formation control.

• The sewing machine 1 is provided with three receivers 94, 95, and 96 to detect ultrasonic waves transmitted from an ultrasonic pen 92.
• The receivers 94 and 95 are provided on the head 14 of the sewing machine 1, while the receiver 96 is provided on the left surface 17 of the pillar 12.
• The ultrasonic pen 92 is not connected to the sewing machine 1 via a cable and does not output an electromagnetic wave signal.
• The sewing machine 1 calculates the specified coordinates E based on the detection timings T2 of the receivers 94, 95, and 96 without using the transmission timing T1.
• The CPU 61 of the sewing machine 1 acquires the detection timings T2 of the receivers 94, 95, and 96 and calculates the specified coordinates E using Formulas (5), (6), and (7).
• The CPU 61 controls the X axis motor and the Y axis motor to move the embroidery frame such that the position of the specified coordinates E on the work cloth 100 matches the needle drop point.
• The CPU 61 starts sewing on the work cloth 100 held by the embroidery frame.
• The sewing machine 1 can accurately identify the specified position on the work cloth 100 using the three receivers 94, 95, and 96.

• **Ultrafine Wool Powder as Carrier**: Wool fibre pulverized into ultrafine powder serves as a carrier for functional additives like ultrafine titanium dioxide, ultrafine zinc oxide, and ultrafine bamboo particles. The helical structure of wool macrofibrils and the amorphous structure of the matrix surrounding them facilitate the carrying and retention of chemicals and water, respectively.
• **Preparation and Application**: The ultrafine wool powder is attached to cotton fabric using an aqueous dispersion of acrylic copolymer binder. The preparation can be applied to the fabric by printing, padding, or foam application methods.
• **Functional Properties**: The treated fabric demonstrates enhanced ultraviolet protection, wicking, wrinkle recovery, and anti-bacterial properties. The ultraviolet protection factor (UPF) of the treated fabric remains in the 'good' protection category even after 25 washing cycles.
• **Wicking and Wrinkle Recovery**: The wicking height of the treated fabric is significantly higher than that of the untreated fabric in both warp and weft directions, indicating enhanced water absorption and capillary ability. The wrinkle recovery angle of the treated fabric is more than double that of the untreated fabric, even after 25 washing cycles.
• **Anti-Bacterial Properties**: The antimicrobial activity of the treated fabric is much higher than that of the untreated fabric, with inhibition percentages of greater than 90% and 13.95% respectively after 10 washes. This confirms that the treatment enhances the anti-bacterial properties of the fabric effectively.

• **Frame Quilting Machine Design**: The automatic quilting machine consists of a pair of posts supporting two cross beams, with a sewing machine head attached to the upper beam and a sewing plate on the lower beam. A quilt table, supported by movable tracks, can move in the X and Y directions, allowing the entire table surface to be accessed by the sewing needle.
• **Electronic Control System**: The machine uses two separate process controllers or computers: one for controlling the quilting table's X-Y movement and another for controlling the sewing machine's functions. The X-Y controller is connected to X and Y motors via X and Y axis controllers, while the sewing machine controller receives voltage commands from the X-Y controller's I/O board.
• **Computer-Aided Design and Pattern Duplication**: The X-Y controller is connected to a monitor and can be programmed with a computer-aided design (CAD) program, allowing users to draw patterns on the monitor and convert them into machine-readable language. The controller can then automatically sew the pattern into the fabric and duplicate it at marked locations.

<summary>
* The present invention is a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a durable three-dimensional image.
* The fabric is formed from a first precursor web with a first fibrous matrix and a second precursor web with a second fibrous matrix, separated by a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim.
* The precursor webs are hydroentangled on a moveable imaging surface with a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The support layer acts as a fiber distribution control layer, limiting intermingling of the first and second fibrous matrices while providing sufficient resistance to delamination.
* The first and second fibrous matrices can be dissimilar, with the lower modulus matrix contacting the imaging device for enhanced imaging.
* The imaged fabric can be subjected to post-entanglement treatments, such as binder application, mechanical compacting, surfactant or electrostatic composition application, and used in various consumer applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.
* The device includes a guide apparatus for the strip of material and a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip.
* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring and can be moved by an air cylinder.
* The movement of the stop controls a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop.
* The stop is adjusted substantially perpendicularly to the feed motion of the workpiece.
* The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.
* The device ensures a continuous operation and allows for sewing relatively stiff strips of material without damaging the needle.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for connecting two tape-shaped knit pieces in a knitting process.
* A flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds is used, with one or both being movable.
* Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted on different ranges of the needle beds with a boundary between them.
* When the knit pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the final course of one knit fabric is transferred to the other needle bed.
* The needle bed is moved to overlay the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric on the loop of the fixed side knit fabric.
* A new loop is formed on the overlaid part, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric.
* This process is repeated to decrease loops in both knit fabrics until they are joined.
* The final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch.
* The end parts of both knit fabrics are joined and arranged in the courses.
* The invention can be applied to various parts requiring tape- or rope-shaped portions, such as sweater collars, tanktop neck ropes, and apron neck ropes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for embedding stranded cables in a flexible thermoplastic material.
* The traction element comprises at least one stranded cable with a core strand sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer.
* The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder for co-extrusion, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.
* The extruder has a thread guide for the stranded cables and at least one matrix, which can be adjusted with and in relation to one another individually, in a plane P angled with respect to the cable plane.
* The method involves degreasing and/or pretreating the stranded cables to improve adhesion, preheating them to a temperature close to the melting point of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.
</summary>

<summary>
* The lockstitch sewing machine's rotary hook has holding means for the bobbin housing arranged on the loop cast-off side, allowing unhindered expansion of the needle thread loop.
* The shoulder formed by projections on the bobbin housing moves the needle thread loop through the gap between the front cam and the shoulder without touching the spring rod.
* The capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod for unhindered thread movement.
* The rotary hook ensures a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop, with or without the use of a capsule release device, resulting in improved sewing properties.
</summary>

* Electrospinning of four-component inks containing liquid silanes, polymers, accelerants, and solvents produced silicon-based nanowires and thin films.
* The four-component inks were processed using thermal treatment or light activation via radical polymerization to transform the deposited fibers into polysilane, amorphous silicon, or crystalline silicon materials.
* The produced nanowires were coated with a coherent, conductive coating and used as a component of composite materials such as anodes for lithium ion batteries.

<summary>
* The arrangement controls thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
* Each spool holder has a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element coupled to it.
* A tensioning lever biases the braking element and is influenced by a biasing arrangement activated by fluid pressure.
* The fluid pressure can be controlled simultaneously for all biasing arrangements, altering thread tension for the entire creel.
* When the warping machine is shut off, the braking force can be increased for a quick braking action.
* The biasing arrangement preferably uses a piston/cylinder assembly and operates without hindering the tensioning lever's movement.
</summary>

• The sewing machine detector of the preferred embodiment uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs to detect sewing machine needle position and speed, reducing the thickness and complexity of the detecting section compared to conventional rotary reflective discs.
• The detector employs optical fibers for both detection and power indication, eliminating the need for separate lead wires and reducing the risk of electromagnetic interference.
• The optical fibers are supported linearly in the detector, reducing stress on the fibers and enabling the generation of additional optical axes as needed.

* The invention provides a simplified process for continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process involves completing coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, and drying, without requiring additional bleaching or desulphurating steps.
* The wash water has a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and is free from excessive Ca2+ and Mg2+ ions.

<summary>
* **System Overview**: The system involves oxygen bleaching of pulp, followed by deaeration in a tank, and then washing in a washer. The filtrate from the washer is used to create a swirling motion in the deaeration tank.
* **Deaeration Tank Design**: The deaeration tank is cylindrical with an open top and a flat bottom, having an exterior diameter 'D' and a height of approximately 2'D'. The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential filtrate swirler inlet.
* **Inlet Pipe**: The inlet pipe is located between the upper surface of the slurry and the top edge of the tank, on a diameter line, allowing pulp to enter above the slurry surface and splash against the side wall.
* **Outlet**: The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the tank, in the same vertical plane as the inlet pipe, with its center line between 0.15 and 0.4'D' from the outside of the tank.
* **Filtrate Swirler Inlet**: The filtrate swirler inlet has a vertical center line between the bottom of the tank and the surface of the slurry, and a horizontal center line between a tangent to the tank and a radial line perpendicular to the tangent.
* **Emergency Bypass Line**: The emergency bypass line is located in vertical alignment with the inlet pipe, between the bottom of the tank and the upper surface of the slurry, with a diameter of 0.12 to 0.2'D'.
</summary>

• The invention provides biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite structures with improved out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
• The structures comprise stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be curved or flat, and can be arranged in various configurations.

• The load-limiting device is designed to dissipate energy during dynamic events, such as earthquakes, by undergoing plastic deformation.
• It is intended to be used in braced frames, where it can be connected to the brace using a connection means, providing biaxial support for the frame.
• The device can be removed and replaced after plastic deformation, allowing for easy maintenance and repair of the structure.

* The bedroom cabinet is of a dual construction with an outer casing and an inner casing, providing mechanical strength and allowing for boxes to be formed in the clearance between them for electric devices or user belongings without projecting within or from the cabinet.
* The cabinet has a clearance over the entire periphery with spacer members interposed, forming a uniform air flow passage for natural ventilation and enhancing sound-proofing effect.

• The invention provides a portable guard rail support for temporary safety barriers, particularly in construction sites.
• The guard rail support consists of a flat base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.
• The base plate is anchored to the floor or ground surface using fasteners or anchors, and the upright column supports the guard rail brackets and tie-off ring.
• The guard rail brackets are L-shaped and affixed to the upright column to support wooden guard rails, while the retaining flange secures a kick board in place.
• The angular brace provides structural stability to the guard rail support, and the safety tie-off ring serves as an attachment point for safety cables or weatherproof tarpaulins.
• A concrete-filled steel base is also provided for use when anchoring the guard rail support to a floor or ground surface is not possible.
• The steel base has a retaining groove for slidably receiving the base plate of the guard rail support and a channel for receiving kick-boards.
• A portable safety barrier is created by locating at least first and second guard rail supports in spaced relation along a drop-off edge and fixing guard rails and kick boards within the brackets and retaining flanges of the supports.
• The guard rail supports can be used with overlapping wooden rails or short wooden stubs to secure the rails in place.
• The guard rail supports can also be used with a mesh-like fence structure to create a fence-like safety barrier.

* The invention uses pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods to stimulate oil production in reservoirs.
* The method combines direct acoustic vibrations from an electrohydraulic (EH) shock wave with electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil flow.

* The splice 200 is used to extend the length of a soil reinforcing element 100 by coupling one or more grid-strips 202 to it.
* The splice 200 consists of wave plates 208 with transverse protrusions 210 that receive and seat transverse wires 104, 206 of the soil reinforcing element 100 and grid-strip 202, respectively.
* The splice 200 is secured using connective devices 216 that clamp down on the longitudinal wires 102, 204 of the soil reinforcing element 100 and grid-strip 202, preventing them from escaping the splice 200.

* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade which provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection produced with basic manufacturing processes, allowing efficient production.
* The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, providing the ability to rebuild a blade by replacing a worn portion, and a process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along the plow blade to maximize desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid, adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities.

• The MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall Cavity System is a masonry cladding system that meets performance requirements of the Building Code, including structural integrity, durability, spread of fire, and external moisture resistance.
• The system comprises proprietary plaster reinforced with pre-papered hot dipped galvanised zinc steel wire mesh and other reinforcement, applied over mesh stapled to 35 mm×40 mm nominal sized H3.1 or H3.2 treated vertical timber battens.
• The plaster is applied in three coats: a base coat, a levelling coat, and a top coat with a standard sponge or plastic float finish.
• The base coat encapsulates the pre-papered mesh reinforcement as well as additional reinforcement at corners and around joinery.
• The levelling and mesh coat contains further reinforcement in the form of fibreglass mesh.
• The final skim coat is sponge or plastic float finish.
• The system provides a moisture resistant surface with the application of a water repellent plaster sealer and a 2 coat paint system.
• Components and consumables of the system include battens, dwangs, wall wrap, flashing tape, powder coated aluminium Z flashings, plain aluminium Z flashing, mesh staples, batten nails, sealant, meter box angle, bolts, washers, PVC sleeve, saddle flashings, proprietary type 304 stainless steel joist hanger, fibre cement board, aluminium Z flashings and uPVC mouldings, plaster and sealer, and reinforcement.

* The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a rectangular opening and a door that slides in and out of grooves on the sides and end walls of the chamber.
* The door is secured by a lockbolt that engages a detent in one bar, and reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lockbolt prevent force transmission to the lock mechanism.

• The invention relates to monitoring and measuring fluid pressures in geological formations, particularly to techniques that isolate the pressure sensor from influences of pressures above and below the desired measurement depth.
• In one embodiment, a conduit fitted with a filter is cemented into a borehole at the desired location, and the conduit is pressurized to clear it of cement grout during installation.
• After the cement grout has set, a fluid is introduced into the conduit to displace the grout around the filter, creating a fluid connection between the formation and the filter.
• In another embodiment, the pressure transducer is installed after the grout has set, and is connected to a packer that can be moved within the conduit to adjust the measurement depth.
• The invention also includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, involving forming a borehole, placing a conduit into the borehole, filling the borehole with a cementitious material, purging the conduit of cementitious material, and forming a lateral fluid path between the conduit and the formation.
• The invention further includes a method of monitoring a fluid pressure in a subterranean formation, involving placing a conduit in a borehole, filling the borehole with a cementitious material, and isolating the pressure measuring inlet of the conduit from other portions of the formation located above and below the inlet.

* The jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function comprises steps at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, elastic members respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
* The joint block blocks up the expansion gap in a bridge girder joint while permitting an expansion gap function to be maintained, preventing tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations for smooth vehicle traveling.
* The elastic members are mainly consisting of laminated rubber, hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, ensuring high slip resistance to tires.
* The joint block, supporting blocks and intermediate joint blocks are of concrete of the same quality as that of the traveling path or of high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete, facilitating difference-in-level management of the joints.
* The expansion gap in a joint portion between each of the traveling path ends and the joint block, between the joint block and each of the supporting blocks, between the joint block and each of the intermediate joint blocks, and between each of the intermediate joint blocks and each of the supporting blocks may be provided obliquely with respect to the axial direction of the traveling path.
* A method of mounting an elastic member in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function comprises the steps of joining the elastic members together across the expansion gap and fixing the elastic member on one side to the step on one side, then subjecting the thus fixed elastic member to deformation toward the bridge girder axis, and thereafter fixing the elastic member on the other side to the step on the other side.

<summary>
* The invention provides an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
* The track includes a wheel channel supported above the floor by legs, preventing fluid from entering and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
* The channel has opposed sidewalls, one extending higher than the other, with a cover plate overlying the top and attached to the higher sidewall by a hinge for easy cleaning.
* The vertical space between the shorter sidewall and the cover plate accommodates the axle structure connecting the truck frame to the wheel.
* Another embodiment uses inflatable elastomer seals along the top edges of the channel sidewalls to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent fluid entry.
* The inflatable seals also act as a brake on the hand trucks, preventing movement along the inclined track system when inflated.
</summary>

* The lock device comprises an engaging member and an engaged member for locking a boom to a main body.
* The engaging member is a plate with a hook part and a slot, supported by a pin and guided by a member.
* The engaged member is a pin that can be engaged with the hook part of the engaging member.
* The engaging member can be held in the lock position or the lock release position by touching the guide member with either a first or second surface.

• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head.
• The suction head has a flexible platform with a central, vacuum portion.
• The platform's central portion can be adjusted relative to the pool bottom to regulate suction efficiency.
• The adjustment is done using mechanisms conveniently located on the top of the suction head.
• The adjustment mechanisms precisely regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central portion and the pool bottom.
• The suction head has outboard roller assemblies at each end, with adjustable axles for fine-tuning the platform's height.
• The suction head also has inboard roller assemblies on either side of the central opening, with adjustable frames for coarse-tuning the platform's height.
• The inboard roller assemblies include a housing, axles, rollers, a lead weight, and a cover.
• The adjustment mechanism for the inboard roller assemblies includes a frame, a connector, a wing nut, and a coil spring.
• The invention also includes a kit for retrofitting existing pool cleaning devices with the adjustment mechanism.

* The apparatus of the present invention is a sub-unit for retrieving wear bushings from around the interior of the well head and casing.
* The sub-unit has a mandrel with a longitudinal bore, a rigidly attached upper collar section, and a threadably removable lower collar section.
* A retriever section is slidably movable between the end collars of the sub-unit and is adapted with protruding members for engaging with a wear bushing.
* The retriever section is prevented from rotational movement by insertion members slidably engaged in grooves on the mandrel section.

• The tool allows for wireline access through its central passage when not in use.
• It uses an annular dump valve that avoids slamming against a seat during cycling.
• The tool delivers increased power per stroke using modular stacked piston units.
• The design allows for continued downward mandrel movement after the dump valve opens.
• The tool can be operated to deliver high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces without impacts.

• The retaining wall system comprises two precast concrete modular parts: a face panel with integral counterforts and a solid base. The face panel has exposed rebar ends that fit into openings in the base, creating a shear key and allowing for grout filling to secure the connection.
• The system allows for taller walls and shorter bases, reducing excavation and installation costs. It also provides flexibility in customizing the height and width of individual components. Optional features include H-piles for added stability, impact barriers for safety, and textured or roughened base surfaces for increased friction.

• The present invention provides a down hole heating system for oil and gas wells with high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage, focusing heat on the production zone to improve flow.
• The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods, insulated from up hole components to retain heat, and shielded electrical connections to prevent invasion by down hole fluids.
• The method of use involves installing the system in the well, focusing heat on the production formation, and optionally using cable instead of pipe for supporting the heating unit during treatments.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a down hole tool for installing and removing objects in wells, such as stuck or lost tools.
* The tool can be used for various service operations, including well servicing, drilling, and fishing operations.
* The tool has an outer tubular body and an inner body structure that can move telescopically relative to each other.
* The inner and outer body structures are connected by a catch mechanism that has a locking position and an unlocking position.
* The catch mechanism includes a pin structure that is selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves.
* A control spring ensures that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another.
* If the tool is locked in relation to the fish or other object positioned in the well bore, unlocking may be achieved simply by downward movement of the control line tool followed by subsequent upward movement thereof.
* Further, in the event the pulling tool is unlocked with respect to the down hole object, locking may be achieved simply by downward movement of the pulling tool, followed by subsequent upward movement thereof.
* The tool can be latched and unlatched as many times as is appropriate to accomplish the service operation involved, without any necessity for removing the tool from the well bore for resetting operations.
</summary>

• The example embodiment provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability and maintainability.
• The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm.
• The substrates are assembled using glue and multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, horizontal and vertical reinforcement means.

* The invention presents a brace for a ladder to improve its lateral stability and prevent damage to work surfaces.
* The brace includes an extension arm with a U-bolt to secure it to the ladder's rung and a resilient pad assembly for non-slip contact with the work surface.
* The arm can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes and can pivot vertically or horizontally to straddle corners.
* The brace assembly can be secured to the ladder using a clamp and bolts, with the option to use a single bolt connecting both sides for added stability.

• The present invention relates to a nail strip with a plastic collation system that reduces debris generation and minimizes nail strip corrugation.
• The plastic collation system is formed from an adhesive polymer, such as a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene, and is molded onto and adhered to the nails. The system includes a collar portion that encircles the nail shank and a connecting portion that extends between adjacent collar portions. The connecting portion can include a bridge and a rib, and can be configured to influence separation at a desired location. The strip can also include upper and lower collations, with the lower collation being narrower than the upper collation.

• The nozzle for applying sealants comprises a bell-shaped tip and an injection button.
• The bell-shaped tip is designed to encapsulate rivets or nuts for complete coverage with sealing material.
• The injection button has a unique design with channels and orifices for precise sealing operations.
• The button can be coupled to the bell-shaped tip in a strong but non-permanent manner.
• The nozzle can be used with most sealant cartridges or injection machines available in the market.
• The nozzle simplifies sealing work, reduces application time, and improves the quality of the sealant application.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a position sensor for sensing the position or movement of an object.
* The sensor comprises a waveform generator and an error correction generator.
* The waveform generator modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer using an error correction signal to provide a conditioned sensing signal.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of the object being sensed.
* The error correction generator comprises a comparator, a controller, and a signal processor.
* The comparator receives the conditioned sensing signal and determines its value.
* The controller provides first and second timing signals responsive to the value of the conditioned sensing signal.
* The signal processor provides the error correction signal responsive to the first and second timing signals.
* The error correction generator constantly compares the value of the conditioned sensing signal to a desired minimum value and generates a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal.
* The constant comparing of the sensor signal output to the desired minimum value proceeds in a first direction relative to a direction of sensor output signals generated when an object being sensed moves in a relatively slow manner.
* The constant comparing of the sensor signal output to the desired minimum proceeds in a second direction relative to the direction of signals generated when the object being monitored moves in a relatively fast manner.
* The error correction generator generates a relatively small reference signal that is large enough to eliminate small values of drift in a negative going direction yet is small enough not to generate a significant amount of signal due to the discrete nature of the calibration voltages from the DAC and counter combination.
* The error correction generator generates a relatively large reference signal that substantially exceeds the largest voltage encountered by the sensor as an object being monitored moves its maximum amount, allowing rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in an offset voltage caused by rapid temperature or other changes.
* The signal processor comprises a DAC and counter combination circuit that contains enough resolution such that even if a sensor offset correction signal is generated as a result of a change in sensor output due to a movement of an object being sensed, the error correction signal is not a significant portion of the conditioned sensing signal representative of a position of the object.
* The sensor is connected to a sensor monitoring system external circuitry through a current-to-voltage converter resistor to a power supply.
* Upon a rapid increase in sensor voltage caused by an inrush of current upon power-up, a preset generates a signal that causes counter to go to its highest value, driving DAC output to its highest value.
* The output of DAC drives

* The invention presents a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
* The system eliminates the need for springs, reducing power consumption and allowing for higher engine speeds.
* It uses a rotating cam and translating means to interact with a second controllable actuating means that controls valve position.
* The second actuating means allows for substantially infinitely variable displacement, controlling the percentage of port opening.
* The system can close the valve port indefinitely while the engine is performing, saving fuel when stopped or at low speeds.
* Computer control allows operation of any set of pistons and variable valve displacement for optimal performance.
* The system is simple, robust, and easily manufactured, assembled, and installed compared to current cam-spring systems.
* Multiple valves per cylinder can be actuated from the same drive link, accommodating engines with more than two valves per cylinder.

• The light member includes a housing with a top side facing away from an aquarium and a bottom side facing the aquarium, with a lighting control region on the bottom side.
• The lighting control region has a first control channel for white light, a second control channel for blue light, and a neutral channel, allowing for adjustable color temperature.
• The light member includes a switch for each control channel, enabling independent control of white and blue light.
• Light-emitting modules can be coupled to the lighting control region, with each module having electrical connectors that mate with the control channels and neutral channel.
• The modules can be moved along the lighting control region and only installed in one orientation, ensuring proper electrical connection.
• The light member can be used with various enclosures, including aquariums and underneath cabinets, with different modules and optics available for each application.

* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine blade.
* The apparatus comprises cooling channels separated by inserts acting as separating walls, which are inserted into the apparatus after casting, unlike traditional cast separating walls.
* The inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials, reducing thermal stresses and blade weight, and simplifying production and adjustment of the cooling system.
* The inserts are secured in place by integral material joints, such as soldering or welding, and can be inserted through the blade root or tip, with holders in the form of rails guiding their longitudinal edges during insertion.

• The system automatically or manually controls a fuel delivery system, such as a throttle valve, based on signals from an accelerator pedal and throttle position sensor.
• It uses a control unit that processes these signals to generate commands for a DC motor or stepper motor, which adjusts the throttle position for optimal vehicle performance.
• The system can switch between automatic and manual control, ensuring a smooth transition and full vehicle operation in manual mode.

• The waste fuel burner efficiently burns wood waste, emitting minimal particulate matter and producing little slag or clinkers.
• It operates effectively on wet wood (up to 70% moisture content) and is self-regulating with fast response times to load changes.
• The burner consists of a primary chamber with underfire air and swirl air, and a secondary chamber with secondary combustion air, all controlled to maintain optimal combustion and minimize emissions.

* The invention provides an evaporative air conditioning system that separates the dry and wet sides of a heat exchanger to prevent water vapor from being added to the useful air.
* The system recirculates a major portion, preferably all, of the working air from the enclosure to be cooled to the wet side of the heat exchanger.
* The heat exchanger uses an array of spaced, vertically directed hollow tubes through which the working air flows countercurrently to water flowing downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes.
* The dry side of the heat exchanger is cooled by fresh air flowing externally across the tubes, and the cooled air is delivered to the enclosure.

<summary>
* The fluid pump comprises two or more pump heads configured in series, with each pump head containing an impeller driven by a common drive structure.
* Fluid flows sequentially through each pump head, with the initial pump head drawing fluid from a reservoir and the final pump head expelling fluid.
* Each pump head comprises a housing with an inlet for drawing fluid and at least three fluid conduits for moving fluid out of the housing.
* The fluid conduits combine into a single flow at a combiner, which is in fluid communication with the inlet of the next pump head in the series.
* The drive structure passes through the inlet between pump heads, connecting the impellers of each pump head to be commonly driven.
</summary>

• The engine includes an engine housing defining multiple cylinders, with an engine compression release brake provided for less than all of the cylinders.
• The engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve and is activated during the compression stroke of the piston to vent compressed air, providing engine braking.

• The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes are expected to withstand various loads, including extreme loads from blade-off events.
• Conventional gearboxes and gearbox connections are constructed to rigidly withstand all anticipated loads, often requiring additional material or being heavier.
• The link assembly includes a male link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, a female link coupled to the engine or the gearbox, and a pin releasably coupled to both.
• The female link receives the male link, allowing translation and forming a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The pin selectively retains the male and female links, and is designed to shear at a known load magnitude corresponding to the maximum structural capability of the gearbox assembly.
• After the pin shears, the female and male links can translate relative to each other, with the radial interface providing coulomb damping to dissipate energy.
• A snap ring can be used to limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link and prevent separation after the pin is sheared.

* The invention provides a lightweight point cap system with adjustable weight for perfect arrow balance.
* It also offers a balance pin that can be trimmed to achieve desired point weight and a point cap that reduces stress on the arrow shaft.

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronic device designed to simulate the sound and flash of small arms fire for training purposes.
• It consists of an electrical control circuit, a bolt interface, a trigger interface, oscillators, a firing counter, a firing decoder, a firing control, firing sensors, and a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System (MILES) interface.
• The device is packaged to resemble a magazine clip for an M16 rifle, with an upper end designed for insertion into the weapon and a lower end housing the electrical control circuitry and a plastic expendable containing pyrotechnic charges.
• The pyrotechnic charges are ignited by heating a bridge wire to incandescence, causing the charge to burn and produce a rapid increase in pressure, which ruptures a plastic sealant and produces overpressure levels and duration simulating small arms fire.
• The device provides realistic training without the use of live ammunition or blanks, reducing costs and increasing safety.

• The air intake device improves engine performance by utilizing dynamic effects and reduces intake noise using a resonator.
• The device has a tank, two interconnecting pipes with different cross-sectional areas, and a valve controlled by engine load and speed.

• The invention is a two-part bracket assembly for mounting objects like speakers to poles, walls, or other surfaces.
• The stationary bracket is mounted on the surface and the adjustable bracket is attached to the object.
• The adjustable bracket is temporarily secured to the stationary bracket using hooks and tabs, then rotated into a final position.
• The brackets are secured together using screws, allowing for vertical adjustment from 0 to -70 degrees.
• For pole mounting, adapter brackets and a chain clamp are used to accommodate various pole sizes and shapes.

• The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, with air flowing through the fuel holder and around the fuel holder to support secondary and tertiary combustion.
• The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber above ground level, and a pivotally coupled ash pan and perforate food grate that can be moved to a deployed position above the flame and to a stowed position to the side of the combustion chamber.
• The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances, including closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.

* **Improved Cooling and Ignition System**: The invention aims to enhance combustion efficiency while reducing the risk of engine housing structural failure by combining an ignition system with an optimized cooling system.
* **Staggered Spark Plug Bosses**: The housing structure features staggered spark plug bosses in the rotor housing's peripheral cooling circuit, promoting separate flow paths for boiling vapor release and minimizing thermal distortion.
* **Enhanced Heat Transfer**: The staggered boss arrangement improves the heat transfer coefficient by at least 20% compared to prior art, ensuring efficient heat extraction and reducing hot spots that could lead to thermal fatigue or thermal shock cracks.

* The invention is a method to minimize flow disturbance during turbine control valve operational safety tests.
* It uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through parallel valves.
* This maintains steam generator pressure constant and minimizes turbine power changes.
* The method does not require monitoring of additional process parameters.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture, with an adjustable ratio ranging from 0% to 100% of each fluid.
* The valve system consists of a valve body with two inlet passages for receiving a first fluid (soap solution) and a second fluid (water) at different pressures, and an outlet passage for providing a proportional mixture of the two fluids.
* The valve body also defines a bore through which an elongated valve member is disposed to direct the flow of the two fluids towards the outlet passage.
* The valve member includes a cylindrical portion with a bore extending perpendicular to its longitudinal axis, and a sealing sleeve with perpendicularly intersecting bores to align with the valve member's bore when stretched over it.
* The valve member also includes cylindrical spools and channels for retaining fluid seal rings to prevent commingling and leakage of the two fluids within the bore and valve body.
* A set screw is provided to restrain translational motion of the valve member after it is received within the bore, and stops are included to limit rotational motion of the valve member.
* The valve member's bore is radially offset from the bore of the sealing sleeve, allowing for varying proportional mixtures of the two fluids as the valve member is rotated.
* The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids emerging from the outlet passage, from approximately 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
</summary>

• The method involves compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, with an entry pressure, to a higher pressure, cooling the gas by heat exchange, and feeding it back into the pipeline with a lower exit temperature and increased exit pressure.
• During warmer periods, the gas is compressed to an excess pressure substantially higher than the desired exit pressure, cooled by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and then expanded to the desired exit pressure and temperature.
• The expansion can be carried out by throttling or using an expansion turbine, which can also perform work and recover mechanical energy.
• In one embodiment, the compression is carried out in three stages: two primary compression stages with compressors having approximately the same pressure ratio, and an additional compression stage with a booster compressor.
• The expansion is carried out in an expansion turbine coupled to the booster compressor, which is the sole drive means for the booster compressor.
• During colder periods, the compressor station can be operated differently, with the compressors working in parallel to achieve the required throughput quantity.
• The arrangement for carrying out the method includes at least one compressor, at least one heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, control units, and an electronic control that operates the compressors and valves to achieve the desired compression, cooling, and expansion.

• **Cooling Fan Mounting System**: The text describes a system for mounting cooling fans to an enclosure without using fasteners, aiming to reduce costs and labor.
• **Fan Assembly Components**: The system includes a motor with a non-rotatable housing, a motor carrier with mounting legs, and a panel with recess portions for mounting.
• **Mounting Leg Design**: Each mounting leg has resilient leg portions separated by a compression gap, with turned-out portions at the end. The panel has openings with enlarged, intermediate, and residual regions.
• **Installation Process**: The fan assembly is first positioned against the panel (load position), then a combined compressive and rotating force moves the assembly to a partially installed position, and finally, further rotation brings the assembly to the fully installed position.
• **Spring Member Function**: A spring member on the motor carrier urges the assembly away from the panel, preventing vibrational noise and ensuring the resilient leg portions remain engaged with the residual opening.

<summary>
* The invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with damping features to protect instruments from damaging flight loads.
* Existing kinematic mounts lack damping, amplifying flight loads to the mounted instrument.
* The invention introduces damping materials into the mounts to dissipate energy and reduce high energy disturbances.
* The damping mechanism is provided at machined hinge or flexure locations of the mounts.
* Two damper designs are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper.
* The spherical damper uses a viscoelastic (VEM) damping material sandwiched between two partial shells.
* The cylindrical slot damper uses VEM o-rings or washers placed within slots around the flexural hinges.
* The mounts can be arranged in various configurations, such as a truss structure or a set of three damped mounts.
* The invention simplifies manufacturing by using identical strut elements and provides the option for a center-of-gravity mounting system.
</summary>

* The clutch unit uses separate piston and cylinder means for each clutch disc segment to minimize residual drag.
* The unit has auxiliary fluid pressure control means for retracting clutch plates from discs and acting as a coolant.
* The clutch discs are segmented, allowing easy removal and replacement of individual segments without disassembling the unit.
* The clutch unit is designed for large size power transmission requirements, with a capacity of 85,000 horsepower.

* The invention combines combustion and expansion cylinders to capture and reuse heat energy, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator.
* Water is injected into the expansion cylinders to create steam, which drives the pistons and further cools the exhaust gases.
* The system can include multiple expansion cylinders in a cascade arrangement, with each cylinder having a larger displacement than the previous one, to maximize heat capture and minimize exhaust temperature.

* The invention provides a plate with a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, with an area at the periphery of the plate having the metal alloy layer removed.
* The metal alloy layer is preferably removed by brushing or laser ablation, and the width of the removed area is between 0.2 and 2.2 mm.
* The plate is used to fabricate a welded blank by butt-welding at least two plates, with the welded joint produced on the edge contiguous with the area from which the metal alloy has been removed.
* The welded blank is then heat treated and deformed to obtain a part with good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.

• The present invention is a remote control system for supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) enabling navigation and automatic operation of a mobile structure that optimally recovers energy from an offshore marine environment.
• The system comprises a mobile energy recovery structure, a central service facility, and a communication system including Global Positioning Satellites (GPS), weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites.
• The mobile structure includes a control and communications microprocessor system that runs a SCADA algorithm, which optimizes efficiency by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, relating these data points to performance models for the mobile structure.
• The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data through diverse means such as GPS systems, weather satellite systems, and various geographic and weather data resources, and run Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software applications.
• The SCADA computer servers communicate with microprocessor systems running client software with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to allow remote humans to optionally interact and choose mission critical navigation plans.
• The system can be used for remote control of any mobile structure that extracts energy from naturally occurring weather patterns, such as windstorms, offshore tropical storms or hurricanes, or any aerodynamic or hydrokinetic electromechanical mobile system for renewable energy recovery under remote control.

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element made of sheet metal with axial profiling and several rolling body guide structures.
* The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, preferably welded, before forming the axial profiling.
* The flat material ring segments are joined across an engagement zone and welded along facing edge regions within this zone.
* The flat material ring segments are connected via positively engaging joint contours forming an undercut geometry for preliminary coupling in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are preferably 120° ring segments, punched out from a sheet metal material, with only three weld points required for joining.
* The rolling body guide cage can be structured for radial or axial bearings, with the latter being composed of two structurally identical ring elements positioned in mirror-symmetry.
* The method for manufacturing the rolling body guide cage involves joining at least two flat material ring segments in succession in the circumferential direction before forming the axial profiling.
</summary>

* <summary>Methods and systems are provided for obtaining and processing information related to a customer service location, including using a global satellite positioning system to obtain latitude and longitude coordinates associated with the service location.
* <summary>Directions for a service technician traveling from a first customer service location to at least a second customer service location can be generated using a mapping system based on "from" and "to" coordinates associated with the respective service locations.

* The system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields comprises two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object against influences of an interfering field.
* The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors to three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable kind of averaging, and generates control signals for the six coils based on these virtual signals.
* The control unit can also account for feedback effects between two compensation systems installed directly beside each other by using a feedback, or crosscoupling matrix C.

• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample using CARS microscopy.
• The method involves generating a resonance signal by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering.
• The sample is derived from a biological source and contains intrinsic chemical structures.
• At least one resonance site is furnished by a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure with at least one reaction partner.
• The bioorthogonal reaction can be a Diels-Alder reaction or a Staudinger ligation.
• The resonance site can be part of the reaction partner or generated by the reaction itself.
• The method can be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures not detectable by conventional CARS microscopy.
• The method can also be used to generate a reproducible counter-stain for the non-resonant background.
• The method can involve furnishing resonance sites for the structures of the non-resonant background and correlating their signal component with that of intrinsic resonance sites.
• The method can be performed using a CARS microscope that selects and focuses pump and Stokes light beams onto the sample.

• The invention provides a system for assessing radiation therapy segmentations, comparing a "gold standard" segmentation with others.
• It uses electronic files containing data points describing three-dimensional surfaces circumscribing structures in a patient.
• The files are converted into volume models, which are then compared to identify common, missing, and extra volume elements.
• A metric method is used to measure the conformance between the surfaces defined by the files, based on the number and distance of missing and extra volume elements.
• The system can evaluate segmentations from different sources, including clinicians in training or different software systems.
• It can also be used for quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines with new imaging technology.
• The system generates a quantitative output indicating the quality of one segmentation with respect to another.
• It provides a visual display of the segmentations, with common, missing, and extra volume elements colored differently.
• The system allows users to define their own metric methods using a simple parameterization.
• The invention can help improve segmentation skills, assess autosegmentation programs, and determine if a new treatment plan is needed based on changes in the patient's anatomy.

• The invention relates to accelerating the execution of floating point operations in data processing systems.
• The focus is on improving the effective subtraction operation, which is more complex and time-consuming than addition due to the need for aligning fractions and normalizing the result.
• The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference between the arguments of the exponents of the two operands.
• When the absolute value of the difference is less than or equal to one, the alignment of fractions and subtraction can be performed simultaneously, reducing the number of steps.
• When the absolute value of the difference is greater than one, the subtraction operation can be performed to ensure a positive result, and the normalization step can be simplified.
• The invention also introduces the concept of using a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.
• The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof) before the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments is available.
• The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, which is already available.
• The invention provides a floating point execution unit that includes apparatus for determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments, in addition to the apparatus for determining the difference between the complete operand exponent arguments.

• The invention is a method and system for tracking specimens acquired from patients, using unique machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, orders, specimen-taker ID badges, and specimen containers. The system ensures that the correct specimen is collected from the correct patient and processed by the correct lab technician.
• The method involves storing unique machine-readable codes in a computer storage, reading these codes using an electronic reading means, and processing them using a computer processor. The processor verifies that the patient and order codes match, stores the codes in a relational manner, and generates signals to acquire and process the specimen. The system also includes a timer to ensure that the specimen is collected within a predetermined time interval.

• The device uses voice recognition and GPS technology to provide golfers with distance and other information verbally.
• It can be incorporated into headgear, such as a hat or visor, and uses a bone conductance vibration sensor for clear voice recognition.

<summary>
* The present invention provides a system and method for checking design rules in integrated circuits with mixed logic and memory regions.
* It applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data to avoid false errors and ensure accuracy.
* Customized design rules are created by modifying standard logic rules to reflect memory-specific parameters.
* The system identifies different types of memory regions and applies the appropriate customized rules to each.
</summary>

• **Waveguide Holograms (WGHs) as Illuminators**: Thin substrate waveguides, optically coupled to a coherent light source like a laser, can provide controlled illumination for demanding objects such as holograms and spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• **Advantages of WGHs**: They occupy less space, have high diffraction efficiencies (up to 0.99), and minimize stray light due to total internal reflection at waveguide surfaces.
• **Disadvantages of WGHs**: Alignment of the laser beam is critical, there's a time delay across the hologram, and nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction is inevitable.
• **Illumination Depletion**: If the hologram is recorded uniformly, the holographic image is not reconstructed uniformly due to decreasing intensity of the illumination beam as it passes through the hologram.
• **Two-Sidedness**: WGHs tend to produce two diffracted beams, one out of each side, which can be addressed by absorbing, reflecting, or using off-axis illumination.
• **Alignment Sensitivity**: This can be combatted by attaching the source firmly to the waveguide or using a spatially and spectrally broad source.
• **Compensating for Illumination Depletion**: This can be done a priori by recording the hologram nonuniformly or a posteriori by exposing a photographic emulsion to the uncompensated beam.
• **Recording Systems**: Two basic architectures were used to record the WGH grating: a modified conventional holographic recording system and a system suitable for waveguides with more stringent requirements.
• **Experiments**: A SLM was illuminated by a white light illuminator recorded using the first configuration, and a hologram recorded by the second configuration was illuminated by a coherent wave to generate a coherent illumination beam.

• The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to identify defects.
• The test apparatus uses a test head with exciting means to magnetize the rotor and voltage sensing means to measure induced voltages.
• Current sensing means measures the exciting current, and processing means calculates resistance and reactance.
• Skew sensing means measures effective electrical skew, and processing means calculates this value.
• The test head has a unique core structure similar to a dynamoelectric machine stator.
• The exciting means comprises current carrying windings forming at least one pair of poles.
• The voltage sensing means comprises a set of coil windings generating a voltage signal representative of the voltage induced in the rotor.
• The skew sensing means comprises a set of coil windings located in quadrature with the poles to sense flux build-up at the end of the rotor due to its effective skew.
